About Me

I'm a software engineer who thrives at the intersection of legacy systems and modern technology. My sweet spot? Taking ancient codebases that everyone else is afraid to touch and transforming them into clean, maintainable, modern software.

With over a decade of experience in defense and aerospace, I've worked deep in the trenches with military test equipment, Oracle databases, and code that predates most web frameworks. I started as an Oracle DBA, which gave me a rock-solid foundation in data architecture ‚Äî and a healthy respect for the complexity hiding inside "legacy" systems.

These days, I'm all-in on AI-augmented development. I use tools like Claude Code daily ‚Äî not as a crutch, but as a multiplier. It lets me move at startup speed while maintaining defense-grade quality. The result? Projects that used to take a year now ship in months.
